data.what_is:
Blueshift helps brands deliver relevant, connected experiences across every customer interaction.

Its Smart Hub platform for intelligent customer engagement provides brands with the complete toolkit to seamlessly deliver 1:1 experiences in real-time across the entire omnichannel journey, including real-time data unification, audience segmentation, predictive intelligence, 1:1 personalization, omnichannel orchestration, and unmatched scale. The flexible, easy-to-use platform unifies customer data from any source, unlocks intelligence with customizable AI, and activates data across touchpoints in real-time using intelligent decisioning.

The path to delivering customer-centric experiences that grow revenue and drive results has never been quicker. Blueshift's Intelligent Customer Engagement platform delivers relevant, connected experiences throughout the omnichannel journey by unifying, informing, and activating data.
data.product_description: Cross-Channel Marketing Automation combined with AI-Powered Recommendations for email, websites and mobile apps. Powered by a 360-degree Customer View.Blueshift is a full CDP + Marketing Automation solution all in one easy-to-use platform.  This allows marketers to unify their customer data and execute omnichannel customer journeys all in one place.  Marketers can segment data, push and sync audiences to paid media, create templates, build recommendations and create journey workflows that connect every part of the full customer journey.   Other CDPs require to you to add on channel orchestration platforms to actually send your messages, but with Blueshift you can do everything you need in one place, easily.

initial_reviews.review_title: Comprehensive multi-channel marketing automation done right
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Blueshift?
The flexibility, relative clarify of the UI, and comprehensive suite of tools. Also, support is very responsive and follows through on every request. The integration and implementation docs are relatively thorough and the mobile SDK is straightforward.

What do you dislike about Blueshift?
The interface is a bit rough around the edges, but it's functional and has few bugs. I frequently use Blueshift (just about every day) and I get tired of having to log in each time. I wish there were a way to extend sessions or provide step-up authentication for senstive changes. Lack of web SDK so everything is "roll your own" in regards to the web.

What problems is Blueshift solving and how is that benefiting you?
Blueshift helps us automate all of our marketing communication efforts. It allows us to set up complex journeys and campaigns that weren't possible with our previous platform and would take months or years to build if we did it ourselves. Our marketing efforts, realized through Blueshift are responsible for a good portion of our revenue.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful CRM Application with the growth of an AI Engine
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Blueshift?
- Core CRM Communication Channels: Whether via Push, In-App, and Email are simple to create yet robust enough to customize to meet marketing campaign needs
- User Activation Data: Blueshift captures a wide variety of key customer data for the business, both at the client (app side) events and custom attribute level. One of the key differentiators in my experience with the Blueshift tool is tracking and utilizing critical customer information. This high-value data comes in handy when creating new segmentations for new and existing campaigns, as well as reporting on success metrics for the business
- User-Friendly Interface: Blueshift's platform has a simple and effective interface for various types of users, from those power users in Marketing creating and sending communications to the data mining analysts. I appreciate the flexibility the tool offers.
- AI Engine: Once Blueshift is within the business ecosystem for a sufficient amount of time, the in-house AI engine has excellent recommendations for new campaigns based on customer activity. This feature saves time and adds value to the CRM team when retaining or seeking new business.
- Customer / Implementation Support Team: The Blueshift experts are great partners to the business. Very responsive, friendly, and insightful, the Blueshift team always has an eye on day-to-day business actions, as well as the future roadmap

What do you dislike about Blueshift?
- System Outages: Not often, but at times server maintenance or upgrades from Blueshift can interrupt existing campaigns.
- 3rd Party Application Integrations: While Blueshift covers most major Customer Data Platforms, it doesn't cover a lot of new and emerging applications that could be helpful in other areas of data activation and analytics

What problems is Blueshift solving and how is that benefiting you?
- Easily segmenting users based on business activity within our application
- Targeting / Communicating segmented users with trigger-based campaigns (push, in-app, and email messsaging)
- Examining and understanding user behaviors based on data captured from activity
- Rapidly expanding core CRM capabilities to new country regions

The ease of setting up the different automation is also a big plus, as is the automatic selection of the best time slots for sending communication. The heatmap feature is well integrated and I found it useful to optimize automated emails. I'm also impressed but how fast Blueshift processess a lot of information, for example when creating a custom segment of less than two thousand people in a 10M+ user database.

What do you dislike about Blueshift?
There are no automated saves on the email builder. The interface isn't adapted to small screens, and some options are well hidden in sub-menus. Especially the advanced campaign settings. I train colleagues on the basic functionalities of the tool, but it remains challenging for them as the interface can be counterintuitive.

Recommendations to others considering Blueshift:
Dedicate this software to huge user bases. For periodic communications to small communities,  I would'nt recommend Blueshift. To be efficient, prefer working with automatic segments. Thety much better handled than CSV/XLS lists.

What problems is Blueshift solving and how is that benefiting you?
I send communications to professionals in various fields. I need to maximize my engagement rate by combining open rate and click rate. Automatically limiting the number of communication a user receives per day allow to work with other teams without fear of ending up in the spam folder. Since my community is based anywhere in the world, being able to send communications in a 24-hours timeframe is game-changing: I don't need to worry about sending an email at an impromptu schedule! Last but not least, the Report tab is fully customizable and it's really easy to show data to my colleagues in a well-organized dashboard.

all_reviews.review_title: Excellent remarketing system
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Blueshift?
Extremely well-designed API system for integration into existing data stores and websites.
Well structured and easily usable campaign setup system.
Well laid out CMS for managing email, SMS, etc., copies.
Excellent documentation and training guidelines for new users.
Good documentation for API users when implementing on websites or internal CRM systems.
The learner centre makes available excellent video training content for people who want to use BlueShift and wish to advance the implementation process.
The implementation team is very hands on and assists with any and all issues and campaign setups so that you have an excellent go live experience.

What do you dislike about Blueshift?
The opt-out management system is too simplistic to cater to current-day GDPR/POPIA opt-out requirements. It currently only caters for flat optout at a channel level for SMS, email, etc. with no ability to add additional channels to the base optout process. The system also does not cater for customised category optout or "opt-down" as many other systems utilise. The workaround of creating a new field per opt-out category becomes too cumbersome. However, the system does allow you to utilise an optout front end which can be customised to utilise an external opt-down system.

Recommendations to others considering Blueshift:
This is an amazing platform for automating your remarketing processes and better engaging with your consumers.

What problems is Blueshift solving and how is that benefiting you?
We run a lot of manual remarketing processes internally. We are now utilising Blueshift to automat our consumer remarketing process. With the automation in place, we are now able to better engage with our consumers.
We are also looking at solving the issue of not having an internal CRM for management of our consumer database.

In addition, we can build models super quickly and also recommendations. The development already thought about recommendations built outside and incorporate this option. It is super easy to upload user attributes.

What do you dislike about Blueshift?

Blueshift help is on spot, so we always got great help, however it would be nicer if we could remove data from the system a bit easier.
The second thing that would be good to add is to have formulas on attributes for segment creation. At the moment each value can be analyzed and it is not possible to compare them. For example if I want to calculate the available income I could use income field - expenses and then apply a threshold. However because I cannot compare variable against variable I need to have the available income pre-calculated and loaded to Blueshift.

Recommendations to others considering Blueshift:
Blueshift is an excellent tool for data-driven communications. I recommend being very mindful when adding new attributes to make sure they have the right type (as type is attributed based on the data of the first load) and always use a test account for testing to keep the production account neat.

What problems is Blueshift solving and how is that benefiting you?
Data driven communication. We are loading tons of data to be able to do micro-segmentation for email campaings. This has proven a huge improve in conversion numbers.

all_reviews.review_title: I use Blueshift for the majority of my work and do recommend it.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Blueshift?
User profiling. It's really easy to troubleshoot customer problems by having all activity, event and campaign data per user profiling in one easy to find interface. I also like the newly introduced template creator. As we use the Visual Editor for the majority of our sends, the new update has made it incredibly clear to build, proof in multiple devices and also test recommendations and dynamic content based on how easy it is to select different users/attributes and see them change in live.

Another benefit is how clear it is to set up and execute campaigns. Having all the campaign, segment and templates in one easy view gives me peace of mind whenever I'm sending campaigns.

What do you dislike about Blueshift?
One thing Blueshift falls down on is the automation and journey builders. At the moment, it feels very static. With most products, you would expect a clear and easy to use drag and drop journey builder, where it's clear to see how the activity will be prioritised, and what happens if a user is skipped from a certain trigger - what happens next? As we're trying to roll out quite complex behavioural automation campaigns, it's quite difficult to build these. What's more, because it's static, it's difficult to amend the ordering of templates and work on the prioritisation without having to delete templates.

Another feature which I think needs work is the testing within automated campaigns. It's great to be able to test subject lines OR templates on an activity, but if you want to test the other option, you have to archive the activity (which I believe takes users out of the flow if they're at that stage, but more importantly archives any results attributed to that activity step). It would be great if we could just swap between template and subject testing without having to archive that activity step.

The only other feature which I think needs work is the dashboard metrics. It would be great if we could build out more compound metrics to display (I think the max is 12?). It would be beneficial to have more of these, but also to be able to change the ordering. At the moment, I think it's ordered by alphabet, whereas I would like to be able to change these to how I perceive campaign performance.

What problems is Blueshift solving and how is that benefiting you?
Not only do we use Blueshift for all of our BAU marketing, it's also really important to us because we use it for our user behaviour analysis, for example using pageload events to see what users are doing on-site and where, as well as the goal events to see where our revenue and product conversions are coming from.

We've solved countless automation issues with Blueshift, which is great. If we can see a better journey builder in the future, this will only unlock us more.

The other solution that stands out is advertising through other platforms, Facebook for example. Being able to use the data syndication feature to segment a particular user group based on events in Blueshift, and then being able to create a lookalike from Facebook through snydicating that data through has definitely increase acquisition conversion, whilst bringing down the costs there.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Blueshift?
It helps us with all the CRM needs - building the email templates, setting up campaigns, measuring the performance of our email campaigns. Advanced features such as using Blueshift's in-built ML models have helped see positive lift with revenue and user engagement by only sending those emails to the users that they are most likely to open or click.

What do you dislike about Blueshift?
It would be great if Blueshift were able to ingest most important metrics data through back-end channels/APIs so that we could also measure the revenue, login activity, etc. all in one place for cohorts of users who were sent emails.

Recommendations to others considering Blueshift:
Blueshift is tailored well to serve different types of audiences such as campaign managers, email developers, product managers to business executives. In the spectrum of less technical to high level business insights, Blueshift does an extremely good job of establishing  clear swimlanes such that its audience gets most out of the tool without requiring any outside help. The only caveat I will bring up is pricing which could act as a show stopper for using Blueshift. If Blueshift does fit your organizational budget, then its an extremely valuable tool to help fulfill your company's CRM needs.

What problems is Blueshift solving and how is that benefiting you?
Some of the problems we are solving are: determining how many emails should we send to user in a week, optimal time of the day when an email should be sent, user propensity to determine which emails users are most likely to engage with, continuous A/B testing on subject lines, email templates, etc.

With Blueshift, we can message every user with relevant messaging that improves their overall experience. We've been able to introduce a number of new campaigns that we couldn't do with previous solutions.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Blueshift?
Blueshift is a powerful tool that offers 1:1 personalized messaging to our users across multiple channels. The sophistication of the segment builder and recommendation schemes allows us to build out a ton of different user journeys.

I also enjoy working with Blueshift as their team is always responsive and works quickly to answer any questions I or my team might have.

What do you dislike about Blueshift?
The UI is quite complex and has a relatively steep learning curve at the beginning. Across templates, campaign,  segment builds and more, the tool isn't very intuitive. However, once you get the grasp of it, it's a very powerful tool.

Additionally, there is no control bucket in the campaign builder which doesn't allow you have a hold out group when running A/B tests. There are workarounds to address this though.

Recommendations to others considering Blueshift:
The sophistication and capability the Blueshift offers is beyond some of their competitors.

What problems is Blueshift solving and how is that benefiting you?
There is currently a lack of analytics and data insight with this tool, but the team is currently building out something to address that and we are very excited for that additional component.

Otherwise Blueshift's support team has continuously helped us create unique recommendation schemes, which allowed us to further build out more messaging opportunities in the users' journeys.

reviewer.reviewer_job_title: VP of Customer, Partner and Community Growth and Engagement

all_reviews.review_title: Big features with small company care
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Blueshift?
With a robust feature set, there's a lot of flexibility and data available by default. Compared to a bigger ESP like SFMC, you have more control over what you can do, from setting up campaigns to segmentation, without needing to have a technical specialist. Support and client management are also really accessible and hands on, which is a welcome change from getting luck-of-the-draw technical support.

What do you dislike about Blueshift?
Sometimes the UX can be tricky, especially for our creative team or users who aren't in there every day.
No visualization workflows for automations, which can mean it's hard to keep track of where users are entering and exiting different flows, and also when explaining campaign series to other people in the team.

Recommendations to others considering Blueshift:
If you know what you're doing, and don't need to rely on off-the-shelf integrations, BlueShift will give you a wide ranges of options and flexibility to execute what you need.

What problems is Blueshift solving and how is that benefiting you?
When you're direct to consumer but not in the ecomm world, you can't use off-the-shelf solutions and integrations as often. The flexibility to store and send in our customer data in the right way for our business, and being able to dig deep into send data, has been very helpful for our lean team.
We also use segments for other purposes, without needing to go to our analyst or use SQL to query our main DBs or run lists manually, which is helpful for our targeted ad campaigns.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Blueshift?
BlueShift makes it very easy to feed data into the platform.  After getting acclimated with the event tracking, we were able to easily integrate around 100 events from our booking process to track customers through the purchasing life cycle.

What do you dislike about Blueshift?
The platform is powerful, but there is definitely a learning curve when it comes to setting up Recommendations (the feature that allows you to customize content, on the fly to each user in your campaign).

Recommendations to others considering Blueshift:
Check out their developer documentation site, it is robust.  Understand the structure of your data before implementing BlueShift.  It can be hard to start over if that is not thought out properly.

What problems is Blueshift solving and how is that benefiting you?
With BlueShift we've been able to eliminate multiple vendors from our Clients usage.  For instance, a customer might have one vendor for cart abandonment emails, one for marketing, and another for web advertising.  With BlueShift our customers can make BlueShift the one vendor needed to automate nearly all of their marketing efforts.

Personalization tools such as hour affinity send-times, algorithms, and conditional content helps me craft better messages for our users. This makes training on Blueshift difficult as it takes a while to explain where to find everything and how to accomplish various tasks. Hopefully, the interface is updated soon and that can address some of these issues. While the support staff is by and large extremely helpful, there are a few agents who are difficult to work with and it can take a while to get answers (or users are blamed for issues that are on the Blueshift side).

Recommendations to others considering Blueshift:
Take the Blueshift Academy Training Course. It is very helpful with learning the platform and understanding ways that Blueshift can be used to build a robust marketing program.

What problems is Blueshift solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are using Blueshift to refine and explore new ways to provide customers with more personalized experiences so they can better use their membership. We've found a lot of benefits with personalized content for users and ways to tailor messages to their preferences.

all_reviews.review_title: Positive experience transitioning from our previous provider.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Blueshift?
Flexibility - There are multiple ways to trigger email campaigns.  We are very limited in our use of the platform, but have plans to expand and use much more of the functionality.  We limited ourselves to replicate what our clients were using in the past, but believe that they will see the benefits of using more of the Blueshift platform.

What do you dislike about Blueshift?
We have a need to retrieve and store certain information regarding the sending of emails, including the image of each email that was sent.  All of the data points are not always readily available.  Sometimes we need to make changes to our processes, external to Blueshift, to ensure we have all of the data that we need to meet our customer's needs.  There are advantages and disadvantages of having an all-in-1 provider where users manage their email templates and campaigns, as well as sending the emails from that platform.  Our new system uses best in class providers for various functions, but the downside to that is that all of the data is not centralized.

Recommendations to others considering Blueshift:
The Blueshift team is continually striving to improve the platform.  They have taken into consideration all feature enhancements that we have submitted and have a robust road map of new features.

What problems is Blueshift solving and how is that benefiting you?
CSG sends emails on behalf of our customers.  The majority of those emails are transactional in nature.  They are triggered by events on the CSG platform, Statement ready, password reset, bill payment acknowledgement...  Since those are not marketing related we needed a way to trigger those emails based on the event occurring on our platform.  A smaller percentage of our overall email volume is marketing related.  The majority of those emails are sent based on criteria our clients maintain outside of Blueshift.  The event to trigger those emails is then sent in a file and the users are already qualified.

all_reviews.review_title: Great for Email Developers
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Blueshift?
If you're an email developer, you're gonna love Blueshift. Unlike some other ESP's and marketing automation platforms, Blueshift doesn't alter your markup (besides minifying the HTML) or add in any additional vendor specific HTML.

Blueshift also uses Shopify's Liquid templating language for adding light scripting capabilities and the ability to iterate over JSON objects.

What do you dislike about Blueshift?
I mostly like the campaign building features that Blueshift offers, but in that area of campaigns, they are missing features from other big platforms like Marketo and Eloqua, like the ability to easily change data points in a campaign; the ability to push a user to another campaign based on a campaign action; more complex branching options at the campaign level.

What problems is Blueshift solving and how is that benefiting you?
On the email template level, we're solving the problem of personalization by leveraging data from JSON events, using Liquid.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful Tool, But Takes a While to Prove It
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Blueshift?
Blueshift is an incredibly dynamic email marketing tool.

Thankfully I'm well versed in HTML coding, so my templates look and function the way I want them. I could see someone getting frustrated with their Drag-and-drop Editor, but there are few (if any) platforms that have perfected that piece of software...My list of pros is as follows:

- Event tracking is in-depth and (sometimes) customizable depending on what you're trying to track
- Can add customer attributes dependent on source
- Segment builder is super fun to use, and it's very easy to create campaigns in the same winow
- Platform is crazy fast. We came from a system that look literally days to upload a list larger than 400k contacts, so it was refreshing to move around in Blueshift with little to no load time troubles.
- Tags...I know this is a weird one, but they have a filtering system where you can tag segments, templates, and campaigns under a tag filter. This makes things super easy to find, and the ability to add the tag is great. I'd suggest tackling this as a framework so you don't end up with 50 tags.
- Testing...the ease and dynamic-ness of testing in Blueshift is super fun. It takes some time learning how to create proper tests if you're getting a crazy with multiple sequences, but it is possible. I vet every segment, campaign, and test with my account rep to validate I'm doing it correctly, so I'd encourage others to do the same.

What do you dislike about Blueshift?
There's not much I don't like about Blueshift, but I have run into a few issues:

- If you don't have a dedicated Backend Engineer or Data Science team that can help construct the data within your catalog, it's going to be a tricky process. We have a custom backend, so setup can take a while.
- We had some data with our events get messed up in the revenue department...this could have easily been spotted when we passed the initial data over, but it was not caught by our account rep and we had inaccurate revenue numbers for the first week of being in Blueshift.
- The save feature can be spotty at times.
- Segments will take a while to understand, and building them confidently will be a decently long process. It takes time, but it's totally worth it.

Recommendations to others considering Blueshift:
Really evaluate if you have the team for this kind of build. It's a huge undertaking if you don't have a team of engineers.

What problems is Blueshift solving and how is that benefiting you?
Blueshift has enabled our company to fully realize the impact of email and automation on our company's marketing efforts.

all_reviews.review_title: A powerhouse of NASA Grade technology
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Blueshift?
Honestly? Triggered campaigns are pretty damn cool, they're essentially set and forget - but obviously don't actually forget about them - you should probably check them from time to time :P

Also the bee template builder shared assets feature, from a dev point of view means a lot of good code re-use. That plus the power of bee templates has really empowered our marketing team when it comes to their velocity and quality.

Blueshift's connectivity with a bazillion different platforms is a definite win also, although it can be overwhelming at first!

The recommendations system is very powerful, but can be tricky to onboard with at first. You can pretty much do anything you want in there though once you get going.

What do you dislike about Blueshift?
The UI can be a bit tricky to navigate, not everything is super clear at first. But I've found that you can usually get any questions you have cleared up on a call with your account manager. It would be good to see all the documentation updated comprehensively though!

The staff user limit is a bit weird, I've often wondered why it has to cost us more to get a few extra staff member accounts added.

Recommendations to others considering Blueshift:
Consider if you are ready for the feature-set that blueshift has to offer. If you just need simple EDM software for some basic campaigns, Blueshift probably isn't for you. If you're a larger corporation who want's a very personal 1:1 connection with your customers, I'd hands-down recommend Blueshift.

What problems is Blueshift solving and how is that benefiting you?
We've needed a single platform to manage our outgoing campaigns for a while. Blueshift solves that problem easily, but then also delivers a bazillion other features which honestly - is a bit overwhelming at first - but also exciting. We've barely scratched the surface in terms of what it can offer, and it's become a massive priority for us as a business to start utilizing the platform and it's many capabilities more!

all_reviews.review_title: The best product for data-driven cross channel marketers
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Blueshift?
I love how easy the product is to use with its very robust feature set. This is one of the few products on the market that was purpose-built to be cross channel from the start.  All of their competitors started out as email only or mobile only and have added channels along the way.  I also love the modern aspects of the platform that other vendors are struggling to add.  Things like in product Predictive Models for marketers, robust easy to use segmentation builder, and the 1:1 recommendation studio.

Customer Success and Support is great.  Unlike its competitors, Blueshift has a very stable platform that experiences almost no downtime.  Both teams have very experienced people that are knowledgeable about Blueshift, but also other important integrated products like Segment, Twilio, and mParticle.

What do you dislike about Blueshift?
I wish the Predictive Model Studio was more self-service.  However, I believe this is on the near term roadmap.

What problems is Blueshift solving and how is that benefiting you?
Blueshift is best for companies that want to leverage large amounts of first-party data for sophisticated business models and data.  It works well for both large and small teams, but users will be happiest if they are trying to move beyond simple abandonment and engagement use cases.

all_reviews.review_title: Dynamic Data-Drive Service and Automated Platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Blueshift?
I truly appreciate the diligence and effort put forth by the Blueshift team. We needed to get this launched before our contracted ended with Salesforce and saw a whole team effort on the Blueshift side. Not only were they willing to help us through any problems, but they were quick, friendly and very knowledgeable.

What do you dislike about Blueshift?
There's some confusing language when it comes to filtering/segmenting your audience. I still have not become familiar with it myself and tend to second guess myself. However, a responsive support team has been my savior.

Also, your not able to file campaigns, segments, etc. I believe that approach could be fixed rather quickly because it shouldn't take much lift in the UI. Again, I was coming from Salesforce where everything can be dropped into folders for organization and quick usability. My suggestion here would be to focus more on the UI and usability for consumers before adding additional features that may only drive more confusion.

What problems is Blueshift solving and how is that benefiting you?
With Blueshift being a top-notch data and automation platform, we've been able to utilize their capabilities to better align with our Ecommerce goals. As mentioned, we were using Salesforce prior and already had transaction capabilities along with downstream marketing and triggered campaigns. The logic within Blueshift is more intuitive and easy to transition onto. We wanted to migrate off Salesforce due to high cost and business acquisitions. Being apart of Blueshift allowed other business units to be built into our services -- for a low cost. This gave us the ability to focus more on our digital flow, i.e. Cart and finally have a holistic view in the digital space. We have yet to integrate all of their features and capabilities but we'll be moving towards that this year!

Also, the language in the segmentation tool can be confusing. I still second guess myself after being in the tool almost a year now.

More timely and relevant communications for prospective and existing customers.
